result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J. Westcott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan J. Westcott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan J. Westcott was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bryan J. Westcott was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
Bond applied  -  Balance still to be collected.
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
May not have contact with Kenosha Outlet Mall or Co-Actors without agents permission.  May have contact with Emery Westcott and his girlfriend' unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: ***JOC IS CORRECTED TO READ:  Sentence for each count is concurrent to each other, but consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 & 3 - Deft. is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Sentence for each count is Concurrent to each other, but Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 4 days.  Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  Deft. is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jodi Meier.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Counts 1 & 3 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 1/15/15 at 2:00 PM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Jodi L. Meier appeared on behalf of the defendant who is in custody and will not be brought over today.  Clerk: PT
Atty Meier states DE has been in custody in Waukesha Co. so she has not had an opportunity to meet with him.  FPT adj. to 11/18/14 at 9:10 AM.
Final pre-trial on October 31, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Deft. is currently in the Waukesha Co. Jail at this time so FPT rescheduled to 10/31/14 at 9:30 AM both the DA and Atty Meier have been notified.
No contact with Emery W. or his residence. No contact with Pleasant Prairie Premium Outlet Mall. No discussion of this case with Sonja C.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Jodi Meier. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 4. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 9-25-14 @ 9:00am with co-def. Atty. Meier requests bond modification. State waives notice requirement. Bond condition modified from no contact to no discussion of this case with Sonja C. All other conditions continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
